citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The program of veterinary care was not made available at the time of inspection. Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ
an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time or consultant veterinarian, the formal
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care. A written program of veterinary care is required to ensure
adequate veterinary care is provided for the animals. This plan must be completed and made available to APHIS upon
request.
To be corrected by March 6, 2025.

The records of acquisition, disposition or transport of animals for two kinkajou, seven four-toed hedgehogs, eight African
Dormice, two ring-tailed lemurs and nine Syrian hamsters were not available at the time of inspection. Every dealer and
exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all
animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor.
These records are necessary to assess the health and well-being of the animals on site and allow tracking of animals
being used for regulatory purposes and shall be held for a minimum of one year after the animal is euthanized or
disposed of. These records must be completed and made available to APHIS upon request.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The program of veterinary care was not made available at the time of inspection. Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ 
an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time or consultant veterinarian, the formal 
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care. A written program of veterinary care is required to ensure 
adequate veterinary care is provided for the animals. This plan must be completed and made available to APHIS upon 
request. 
 
To be corrected by March 6, 2025. 
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records of acquisition, disposition or transport of animals for two kinkajou, seven four-toed hedgehogs, eight African 
Dormice, two ring-tailed lemurs and nine Syrian hamsters were not available at the time of inspection. Every dealer and 
exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all 
animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. 
These records are necessary to assess the health and well-being of the animals on site and allow tracking of animals 
being used for regulatory purposes and shall be held for a minimum of one year after the animal is euthanized or 
disposed of. These records must be completed and made available to APHIS upon request. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
